activities:
Animas Corporation receives personal information in various forms relating to personnel, including prospective and former employees. These data are transferred from the EU to the United States and are used to carry out the company’s human resources functions. Animas also receives personal information about research subjects, patients, investigators and staff, service providers and business partners, healthcare professionals, suppliers, and industry experts all in support of Animas’ clinical research operations. In addition, Animas receives personal information about its customers in support of customer service functions. Please contact us with any questions about the way in which we process personal data. 
Corporate Office of Privacy
Nancy Bernstein
Phone: (408) 956-4376 or email us at nbernste@its.jnj.com
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Personal Data Covered: Human Resources Data, Clinical Data, Customer Service, and Complaint Handling/Adverse Events
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) (for human resources data); JAMs (for all other data)
